Name: Optimizely DXP - Deploy NuGet package
Description: Take a NuGet package from your drop folder in Azure DevOps and upload it to your Optimizely (formerly known as Episerver) DXP project and start a deployment to the specified environment.

Parameters.Name: ClientKey
Parameters.Label: ClientKey
Parameters.HelpText: The DXP API ClientKey for the current environment. This ClientKey can be generated in the Optimizely paas portal.

Parameters.Name: ClientSecret
Parameters.Label: ClientSecret
Parameters.HelpText: The DXP API ClientSecret for the current environment.

Parameters.Name: ProjectId
Parameters.Label: ProjectId
Parameters.HelpText: The DXP project id. Can be found in the Optimizely paas portal under API tab.

Parameters.Name: sourcepackage
Parameters.Label: Package Name
Parameters.HelpText: Specify the package you want to deploy

Parameters.Name: TargetEnvironment
Parameters.Label: TargetEnvironment
Parameters.HelpText: Specify which environment that you want to check ex Integration/Preproduction/Production.

DisplaySettings.Octopus.SelectOptions:
Integration|Integration
Preproduction|Preproduction
Production|Production
ADE1|ADE1
ADE2|ADE2
ADE3|ADE3

Parameters.Name: DirectDeploy
Parameters.Label: DirectDeploy
Parameters.HelpText: Specify if you want to do a direct deploy without using slot and warmup.

Parameters.Name: WarmUpUrl
Parameters.Label: WarmUpUrl
Parameters.HelpText:
Specify if you want to warm-up the web application after direct deploy. It will request the specified URL and all links found on the page.
If there is some tests running against the web application with direct deploy there is a problem that the web application is not started and warmed up.

Parameters.Name: UseMaintenancePage
Parameters.Label: UseMaintenancePage
Parameters.HelpText: Specify if you want to use a maintenance page during the deploy.

Parameters.Name: Timeout
Parameters.Label: Timeout
Parameters.HelpText: Specify the number of seconds when the task should timeout.

Parameters.Name: ZeroDowntimeMode
Parameters.Label: ZeroDowntimeMode
Parameters.HelpText:
The type of smooth deployment you want to use. More information about zero downtime mode
If this parameter is set to empty, no zero downtime deployment will be made. It will be a regular deployment.

Parameters.Name: RunVerbose
Parameters.Label: RunVerbose
Parameters.HelpText: If you want to run in Verbose mode and see all verbose messages.
